The phrasing evolved somewhat over the years until the writers found one they liked.

Q Who-
'We have analyzed your defensive capabilities as being unable to withstand us. If you defend yourselves, you will be punished.'

The Best of Both Worlds-
'I am Locutus of Borg. Resistance is futile. Your life as it has been is over. From this time forward you will service us.'
'The knowledge and experience of the human: Picard is part of us now. It has prepared us for all possible courses of action. Your resistance is hopeless, "Number One"'

I, Borg-
'We are Borg. You will be assimilated. Resistance is futile.'
'Just look around, pal. You're hardly in a position to make any demands.'

Star Trek VIII: First Contact-
'We are the Borg. Lower your shields and surrender your ships. We will add your biological and technological distinctiveness to our own. Your culture will adapt to service us. Resistance is futile.'
